results.title: Train No. 6
results.creator_credit: ACMI, SBS Independent and Daniel Crooks
results.brief_description: Using Melbourne’s urban landscape, ‘Train No.6’ extends Crooks’ exploration of his ‘TimeSlice’ technique. A simple train is reconfigured across time to form mesmerising polyocular images.
results.description: Using Melbourne’s urban landscape, ‘Train No.6’ extends Crooks’ exploration of his ‘TimeSlice’ technique. A simple train is reconfigured across time to form mesmerising polyocular images.

results.title: Short band video
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Daniel von Sturmer
results.brief_description: Continuing from his ‘Truth Effect’ series, and the tradition of George Méliès, Daniel von Sturmer creates a miniature environment in which an everyday object behaves in unexpected ways.

results.title: Paper War
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Guan Wei
results.brief_description: This simple tracking shot along Guan Wei’s exquisitely drawn battle scenes, silhouetted against a traditional landscape scroll, suggests the right-to-left movement of Chinese reading.

results.title: Japan
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
Shows how the various religious beliefs of the Japanese influenced their history. Commentary by John Temple and photography by Dean Semler.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
Shows how the various religious beliefs of the Japanese influenced their history. Commentary by John Temple and photography by Dean Semler.

results.title: Japan: the bamboo bends and does not break
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, Film Australia and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
Provides insight into the historical and cultural background of Japan, drawing attention to the sense of duty and obligation held by the Japanese in ways that are different from people in the West. Photography by Dean Semler. Unit Manager: Damien Parer.

results.title: Hong Kong, Singapore: fragrant harbour, lion city
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, Queensland University of Technology, Film Australia and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the cultural background of Hong Kong and Singapore. Both places are governed by the professional elite ruling class. However, they have produced very different societies under the pressure of history and circumstances. Sujitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Birth of the baroque
results.creator_credit: Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Art of the western world”.
The 17th century interiors of Protestant churches were filled with Baroque art. Congregations were brought to God through the richest and most dramatic use of religious imagery. The architecture, sculpture and painting of the Baroque were designed together, part of a total and individual whole. Vigorous movement embracing the entire facade is also a characteristic of Baroque architecture and Caravaggio is highlighted in this episode.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)

Vigorous movement embracing the entire facade is also a characteristic of Baroque architecture and Caravaggio is highlighted in this episode.

results.title: Malaysia: sparrow with sparrow, raven with raven
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the historical and cultural background of Malaysia. Religion and politics play an important part in the life style of the people. Suitable for secondary level.
